column4: textboxes are no longer allowing input; how can i change the settings without input?
it's X dependant
is there a way to open a terminal window without a panel?
terminal doesn't accept input, either
is there a way to start a window manager without using the terminal, because nothing is taking keyboard input except for the fallback terminal?
an X-dependant window manager
you can us  alt+F2  the run dialog  oh
didnt keep up with your post
i said nothing is accepting keyboard input

just to make sure you read this, i'm going to say it again, because i really need the help: start up the computer, and kill compiz because it kept looping compiz --replace and killing itself because of a pixcreate and pixdestroy error
it was in reply to you asking what i did before the keyboard input stopped working
ah ok
had to use fallback terminal, by the way, because the screen elements aside from the desktop background kept disappearing and reappearing repeatedly
ooo  mm
i just want to revert to metacity
is there any way to fix this?

not sure  ,.. I apologize for not having paid close enough attention to your posts  to get a clear image of what is happening.... doing testing and bug fingding so my attention was severely  thinned out
if you'd like some details, i'd gladly give you some. i really need the help.
well I think the more details posted here the more some one can get a better idea of the issue  ...I cant gurantee that will be me but posting detials is important
well emerald is a window decorator and compiz a window manager  what you want to use is either  gtk-window-decorator  if on gnome  or kde4-window-deorator if on kde
compiz will not decorate the windows
i know
without keyboard input
and no compiz?  metacity --replace & disown in terminal  or  alt+F2  metacity --replace
how can i do that without keyboard?
i can only use the fallback terminal
mm
not sure  ...how are you typing here?
oh ok
ok this one is a little odd... i cant off hand thing of any troubleshooting , if no one here can solve this right now you could try the ##linux channel as well
oh, after logging back in because of the screensaver locking it, the keyboard input is back
so i started metacity
ah ha :)
i'm fine now; thanks for the help
no  problem...sometimes  logging off and on or just rebooting can solve issues :)
